summary: Slikey, re: YT removing sorting by upload date
mainText:
'This was how I discovered really small channels the past few weeks to leave comments and engage with. Well RIP..
Usually sorted by upload date to make sure I discover independent of any algorithm bias.'

summary: Oscar, re: Hero's of Orbis being good music for workouts
mainText: 'That's lovely‚ò∫Ô∏èI can't do pushups or yoga without my daughter climbing or crawling underüòÇ so it usually becomes demon hunters dance workout. You could try Kweebec Summer Party in a workout playlistüéµ I'm tempted to make all kinds of alternative Hytale albums though'

summary: Slikey, re: moving mouse out of window in fullscreen
mainText:
'It is an older tech which has been deprecated in Windows 11. The reason is that previously displaying graphics in a window (even if borderless) was much slower than the game writing directly to the Monitor.
When you tabbed out the game had to return control of the screen back to windows. 
We are using a modern library SDL3 which doesn't have that problem and you should have a good time tabbing in and out of the game.'

summary: HPMoo, re: returning to Hytale
mainText:
'If I could bottle how I feel now....

Now.
Get flipping ready. 
I hear the thunder in the distance getting ever closer. ARE YOU READY????'

summary: Slikey, re: mod-sharing potentially working like Steam Workshop
mainText: 'That'd be feasible if the mod was on the modding discovery backlog just like steam workshop. Anything outside that. I think there is some work for us to explore the "threat model" and do risk analysis for all possible paths.'

Slikey, re: sharing mods in-game

summary: Propzie, re: user saying they forgot to add futuristic flying vehicles

summary: Propzie, re: Cyberpunk map
mainText: 'It was super fun to build in a completely different style to what we normally do in Hytale. It's incredible flexible and you really can just make what is in your imagination!'

summary: Simon, re: Cyberpunk map
mainText:
'2 people in 5 days.
Now imagine what players will do in the next few years.

By players, for players.
By modders, for modders.'

summary: Propzie, re: Cyberpunk map
mainText: 'This was really fun to build with @ThomasFrick we had both been dreaming of using the game to make stuff like this cause we knew it was possible. Hytale is SO flexible you really can make anything from your imagination.'

summary: Hytale showcases old custom Cyberpunk map
mainText:
'This Hytale custom map was built by 2 team members during an internal mod jam a few years ago!
They created new blocks, weather, and furniture, and built this map. All in 5 days!

After release, we will make these blocks, furniture, and items available for players to use in Creative mode. Maybe someone will create a Cybertale adventure map or even an MMORPG server...

Please note that this video doesn't feature our lighting fixes and other improvements we have been doing in the past few weeks. #Hytale'

mainText: 'We will be rolling these out in the future'

summary: Simon, re: NoCube's mods
mainText: 'Really great looking mod by @NoCube_Mods can't wait to see more!'

summary: DSN, re: why it's recommended to remove password
mainText: 'Passwordless accounts are more secure than ones with passwords! We recommend people use SSO providers for auth only (Google, Discord, etc)'

summary: DSN, re: staying logged in on Hytale.com
mainText: 'This will be rolling out in the future, at the moment the main page and back end systems are on 2 separate tech stacks'

summary: DSN, re: user questioning wording on 2FA popup
mainText: 'Good catch, we'll clean up the wording to be more clear! Thanks'

summary: DSN, re: accounts page stuck loading
mainText: 'This should be resolved now'

summary: DSN, re: 'getting started' screen stuck loading
mainText: 'This should be resolved now'

summary: DSN, re: 'getting started' screen stuck loading
mainText: 'We're taking a look into this now'

summary: Simon, re: Tourne_Vis' Hytale mech model

summary: Simon, re: user wanting to see raw game without mods
mainText: 'Working on non-modded content as well, but being careful not to spoil too much, especially the Forgotten Temple :)'

summary: Simon, re: KC joking about all the news and mod showcases
mainText: 'I got more coming boys'

summary: DSN, re: using yubikeys
mainText: 'As a lover of them, yes that is the plan'

summary: DSN, re: adding Security Keys
mainText:
'We had some test implementations but we want to make sure we get the flows right. Some people want sec keys as a 2fa methods, some want it for passwordless auth. 

We will look to enable this in the future for sure, but we're still working out the details.'

summary: DSN, re: user not being able to login to website
mainText: 'Please have him reach out to support at https://support.hytale.com'

summary: DSN, re: user being confused with OIDC term
mainText: 'Yes sorry, I should stick to SSO its a lot clearer :P'

summary: DSN, re: disconnecting Hytale account from Gmail account
mainText: 'This is something we will explore, for now you can add a new SSO method and it should allow you to remove the other.'

summary: DSN, re: user not a fan of Login With Discord
mainText: 'We are working to add additional security checks in cases of token theft, these would trigger additional security checks to be passed before allowing auth'

summary: DSN, re: user saying 2FA is best
mainText: 'Passwordless doesn't mean no 2fa, OIDC + 2fa is the preferred setup'

summary: DevSlashNull, re: updates to Hytale account manager
mainText:
'We've rolled out security updates to the Hytale account manager ahead of launch:

-Email 2FA codes for email+password accounts

- Session invalidation across website, game, launcher & servers

-Extra security checks on critical flows (email changes, passwords, etc.)

-Passwordless option (remove password) for SSO accounts (Google, Discord)'

summary: DevSlashNull, re: seeing which sessions are logged in
mainText: 'This is planned for V2'

summary: DevSlashNull, re: why using email as verification code is an option
mainText: 'This is a limitation of the accounts system back end at the moment, this is a by product of us enabling 2fa email codes for password+email accounts, we're working to give more granular control of 2fa methods.'

summary: DevSlashNull, re: user asking why Hytale says it recommends removing password
mainText: 'Passwordless accounts are more secure than ones with passwords! We recommend people use SSO providers for auth only (Google, Discord, etc)'

summary: Simon, re: user asking why it takes so long to break a bed
mainText: 'because he didn't a proper tool to do so lol, also a simple json file change to make it faster'

summary: Simon, re: purpose of timed crafting
mainText:
'yeah, thats why we want to keep crafting times, upgrading the bench increase the speed and other things, its intentional game design
later on we could add NPCs that could assist with your processing benches to speed it up as well'

summary: Simon, re: crafting bench upgrades
mainText: 'yeah, we want to incentive players to build houses/villages and take care of their homes'

summary: Simon, re: user saying a lot of mods could be in base game
mainText: 'of course, but needs proper time and design :)'

summary: Simon, re: crafting benches
mainText: 'There are other types of benches; I'll try to record some clips. Builders bench is different, for example.'

summary: Simon, re: ITLW saying crafting timers can be tedious
mainText:
'Crafting basic items takes no time, such as building materials/survival gear/traps!
Crafting time is mostly for armour or upgrading the bench, which takes a few seconds.  

I strongly suggest people experience the vanilla version of crafting first; it builds excitement to craft something big you worked for!'

summary: Simon, re: mod stability
mainText: 'In early access, it might break a bit more frequently, but it shouldn't be too bad, honestly.'

summary: Simon, re: future-proofing mods
mainText: 'Our ongoing updates should not break mods unless we make changes to that specific part of the game. We have a strategy to give modders some time before it goes live if we do plan to break it.'

summary: Simon, re: possibility for dev's hobby mods to make it into game officially
mainText: 'In the past, many of our features were "fun" side projects features ended up in the game'
